column4: Hi...  I am an ubuntu noobie.  I just plugged in m DV camera (Panasonic NV-GS11) with firewire and my system is not recognising it.  Any ideas why not?
what do you see when you type dmesg |tail in a term window?
Yes type that and read the output.  Tell me if it says anything about your camera
I have no firewire devices to test myself.  try:   lsusb
Wat do you mean by lsusb?  Usb post?
type lsusb at the term window and see if your camera get mentioned
various things mentioned...  but no explicit reference to the camera... some things anonymous, though...
I'll try unplugging to see if there is anything different?

like I said I have no firewire equipment to see what it reports as.  do this:  dmesg |tail (and notice the output) unplug camera & dmesg |tail again (notice). Plug in camera dmesg |tail again  -=> something MUST showup about your camera
exactly the same when I unplugged....  What were you trying to do with dmesg | tail  ?
type that in your term window
when i unplugged, it told me:  [17183709.504000]  ieee1394: Node suspended: ID:BUS[0-00:1023]   GUID[00804580b12fb1bb]
that's good atleast your firewire port is working & supported
when i plugged in again, it told me:  [17183916.088000]  ieee1394: Current remote IRM is not 1394a-2000 compliant, resetting...
when i plugged in again, it told me:  [17183916.088000]  ieee1394: Current remote IRM is not 1394a-2000 compliant, resetting...
